posts.title: Trump administration halts Harvard’s ability to enroll international students
top_comments: Here comes the lawsuit.
And what about when the King of Saudi Srabia or the Sheikh of Qatar want to send a son or grandson to Harvard. I have a feeling there will be exceptions
Is this not fucking insane? This feels like such a step up in intensity.
"Small government" strikes again.
The party of small government and personal freedoms everyone

Hopefully the school can get an injunction against this action.  It is purely speech based and there are no grounds for it other than to please the dictator.  These are dark days, and it will only get worse for us.
I could hear the collected knuckle cracks from Harvard's law school from here.
Damn democrats! Weaponizing the government! /s
Imagine being an international student in your last year and having this happen.
This also apparently forces *current* international students to transfer, which is absolutely asinine

posts.title: Treasury Department set to phase out the penny
top_comments: So how many people will be hoarding pennies thinking they would be worth large sums years down the road as collector items?
Good. Can we stop having prices end in .99 then?

This is the type of stuff that DOGE should've done instead of gutting many different departments. Phasing out the nickel and penny will save the US Government millions a year. It's proven many times that this is a fact and not just political nonsense.


Edit: I know what DOGE really was for. I'm not as dense as our conservative counterparts.

A penny costs about 3 cents to mint.

A nickle is about 14 cents to mint.
Phew, that should settle the bond market.

One of the 1st things I discovered when I moved to New Zealand in late 2009(originally intending to live there....long story, heh, but I've been back home in the States for over a decade, now) was that they had phased out their 1 and 5 cent pieces and gone to a swiss rounding system; if an item was $4.24, it rounded down to $4.20 and if it was $4.25, it would round up to $4.30.

The sales tax was built into the price, too...what you saw on the tag was literally what you paid....
CGP Grey lighting fireworks

I'm not against this.  Probably should have been done a decade ago.

They now need to make it a law that EVERY gas station in the country has to remove the permanent "9/10" tacked onto their price signs.

And while they are at it,  NOTHING can ever be priced at  .99 cents  EVER again.
What does this mean for paying in cash and getting exact change?
now do daylight savings.

posts.title: Man stripped naked, beaten with poles after calling people 'N-word' in Mississippi bar, police say
top_comments: A man walks into a bar looking for a fight, people are shocked when he gets what he wants. /s
This sounds like a Boondocks episode. Wtf did he think was going to happen?
As a Pole I'm just glad we could be of service

> Davis said he doesn't believe the club to be a problem spot. 

There's no one of that name identified in the article, but previous quotes were attributed to a Miles Stone.  
Did the author refer to Miles Stone as Davis?  [Miles Davis?](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miles_Davis)
There has to be an easier way to get invited to the White House.
Incoming GoFundMe for this moron
Was he playing Simon says with Hans Gruber’s brother or something?

Most people: “Fantastic!”

Cops: “Ermm, looks like a hate crime…against the racist.”
This just in: Actions have consequences.

Lol I want to do business in that town. 30 calls to the place, no liquor or business license, and they still haven't been shut down. Looks like someone bought a house and just decided to run a bar out of it. That's freedom. That's America.

posts.title: Divided Supreme Court Rejects Bid for Religious Charter School in Oklahoma
top_comments: 4-4 split decision. Amy Coney Barrett recused herself.

Divided over whether tax-payers should help pay for a religious school.  

Let that sink in.
I'll take whatever win comes at this point.

"The Supreme Court on Thursday effectively ended a publicly funded Catholic charter school in Oklahoma, dividing 4-4"

Fuck me, that's way too close. This should've been a unanimous vote, not this horseshit. This was going to be a clear violation of the separation of church and state, the government clearly endorsing a specific religion.
If a Christian religious school gets funding that will set a precedent. Muslim, Jewish, and other non Christian religions will want to be funded. Christian groups are not thinking of the big picture.

Well, either it gets shot down, or many a "School Of Satan" will start applying for charters and suing when they are refused, tying up this whole thing in courts for years anyways. 

The Satanic Temple is already fighting against Missouri's "School Chaplain" bill. 

>*Dr. Gwyneth Woodhouse, a Missouri parent and TST member, testified against the bills, emphasizing their broader implications. “If this bill passes, all religions must be given equal opportunity to participate,” Woodhouse said. “My child—along with the children of thousands of TST members in this state—must be given equal access to guidance aligned with our religious values, including bodily autonomy, critical thinking, and resistance to tyranny.”*

>*Minister of Satan Virgil Ovid of TST’s Missouri congregation also addressed the committee, formally offering Satanic chaplain services to any Missouri school district that establishes a chaplaincy program.*

>*As Missouri moves toward publicly funding religious chaplains in schools, The Satanic Temple will take every necessary step to ensure its members’ children receive the same opportunities to access on-campus religious support as any other religious group.*

([SOURCE](https://thesatanictemple.com/blogs/news/missouri-school-chaplain-bills-face-constitutional-test-as-tst-prepares-ministers-of-satan-for-state-funded-positions))
Disappointing that it was an even split, but thank goodness it was rejected.

Oh, we don't know whether it was Roberts, Kavanaugh, or Gorsuch who provided the 4th vote.

If I had to guess, I'd say Roberts.
Four Supreme Court justices can’t even make it past the First Amendment before completely blowing it. Absolutely insane.

Interpretation of the law is either done in good faith or bad faith, and several of these folks move to bad faith by default, every. time. it seems.  


Personal opinion about something isn't the basis for a decision if you're a judge, or isn't supposed to be.  A given person who would never get an abortion, for example, could still believe that the law provides the ability to choose to the individual.  


Court decisions also do not make new laws, only interpret application of laws within the context of the facts in a case.  It's a sad state to be in where you believe personal opinion and bias is the determining factor.

posts.title: St. Louis tornado sirens didn't sound in deadly storm. Now a city commissioner has been placed on leave.
top_comments:
>However, even if someone had pressed the button at the Fire Department, city officials learned Tuesday that the button was not working. 

>"Work to repair the button began Tuesday afternoon and is expected to be completed within days," Spencer's office said. 

Their tornado button is broken. This story feels surreal.
This is so bizarre. I lived in a small town close to St Louis, and I swear they tested the tornado sirens once a week.
A city with 60 sirens and not one sounded. That’s not just a mistake, that’s systemic failure.

I live close to an area that has an emergency siren like this, but I’m not too familiar as I am new to this area. Does anyone know if you can connect your phones to the sirens so when they go off your phone gets an alert? Is this a thing?

*Sarah Russell, commissioner of the City Emergency Management Agency in St. Louis, will remain on paid administrative leave as an external investigation proceeds into what went wrong.*  


*Until a permanent replacement for Russell is found, St. Louis fire captain John Walk will serve as the interim emergency management commissioner.*



I’ll be interested to see the conclusions of the external investigation. I wonder what they’ll determine.

There are too many inconsistencies here.  On reading down through this thread, it appears that people in the STL area are saying that they were testing the alarms in the days leading up to the storm. So they were working.

The story from officials is that the person in charge of pushing 'the button' was away and that there was a failure to communicate that 'the button' needed to be activated. So there is only one way, means and location to activate the system?

When they went to push 'the button', the same one that they had been testing with a few days earlier, it was broken?

This seems to be a systemwide breakdown in planning, chain of command, and procedures.  You don't install 60 sirens around the city without acknowledging the threat of a tornado in your area is a very real possibility.  You don't spend that type of money without putting some type of infrastructure in place, including maintenance, testing, redundancy and personnel to make sure that it works.  There has been some systemwide failure here.
We blow ours on the first Wednesday of every month at noon whether we want to or not
I had a tornado occur in DFW, TX with no siren. My dog woke up. Pretty wild to think about really.

Last Month, no sirens were heard when an F1 touched down in a neighbouring town to me.

This Monday, no sirens were audible, nor was a Tornado warning issued, in suburban Nebraska areas.

This administration is going to get people killed, and I'm of the opinion they want that to happen.

EDIT: I understand the issue in St Louis was because the alarms aren't working, but I'm also confident that warning systems working improperly is a widespread issue right now and that the departments that should be fixing it are under turmoil due to this administrations current choices
This is what maga has to offer.

posts.title: Person shot outside CIA headquarters by security guards
top_comments: I accidentally made a wrong turn there by mistake once , they surrounded my car with their hands on their guns, had me roll down all my windows and then interrogated me before letting me go, they weren’t very friendly at first but were nice enough to give me directions once they determined I wasn’t a security threat just an idiot
CIA main gate is a magnet for the mentally ill unfortunately. This headline could be copy and pasted every three or four months.
Everyone knows that you can't break into Langley unless you're Ethan Hunt

Guards at CIA headquarters opened fire on an individual early Thursday morning in what the agency called a “security incident,” a person familiar with the matter told NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell.

The non-fatal shooting on CIA property in Langley, Virginia, occurred hours after officials said two Israeli Embassy staff members, Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Milgrim, were shot and killed outside D.C.’s Capital Jewish Museum.

**There is no evidence that the two incidents are linked.** The CIA did not immediately respond to CNBC’s request for additional information.
Not surprising. There's a guy there called Stan Smith that crashes his SUV into the flagpole daily. They're on edge.

"Well,  uhm... there was a snag. This analyst, Cox, was attacking the gym guy. Uhm, it was in broad daylight, on the street, our man uh did not know what to do, felt he had to step in... he uhm... he shot the analyst, he shot Cox."
$5 million to his family, pronto

Halloween, 1990, during the build up to Gulf War I.
I worked at an aerospace company that supported NASA and the Air Force. Our department (on a secured campus) sent around a memo encouraging wearing a costume to work. I dressed up in a traditional Arabic robe and headdress.
Unbeknownst to me, there were more ramblings out of Iraq that Saddam was “activating terrorists worldwide.”
I drove my beater Volvo station wagon to the security gates to get to work. Suddenly, I’m staring down the barrels of several large rifles and I’m out of my car and lying spreadeagled on the pavement.
Yeah, that was a fun day. And I was the one who had to write it up for the Security office. My “inappropriate sense of humor” was discussed at length in my next clearance interview.
Omg, thats Jason Bourne.
Don’t worry this person will be paid $5 million in a couple of months.

posts.title: Judge allows lawsuit alleging AI chatbot pushed Florida teen to kill himself to proceed
top_comments:
>A U.S. federal judge on Wednesday rejected arguments made by an artificial intelligence company that its chatbots are protected by the First Amendment — at least for now.

[AI generated art isn't protected by copyright.](https://mashable.com/article/ai-generated-art-cant-be-copyrighted) I can see a case being made that there's no First Amendment protections for it either.
One of the things a compsci friend of mine suggested was that AI is generally biased towards being agreeable. This is a really bad thing for medical advice. And... you know... facts.
He was useing a chat bot that will try to always agree with you, and he was useing coded language..

If this is the Daenerys chat bot I read about beforehand, I feel like this one isn't on the devs. I remember reading the last bits of the convo, and the bot was telling him to not hurt himself. But then he codes his suicide as "coming back to her," so of course the bot is going to agree with the last sentiment if it has no context of self harm. 

I'm only the slightest proponent of AI bots, as they're useful for tabletop RPG stuff and world building, so I may be a little biased here. I'm sure the judge was given something substantial enough to decide this is indeed worthy of a case, so only time will tell if the devs could've done something more to avoid this.

Devs should have a complete log of the convo, so who knows if something earlier suggests the bot was being overly agreeable on topics that convinced the victim to go through with it.

What inputs did the chatbot take to suggest such, this needs to be investigated. Really hope that people have good friends to talk to and not rely or depend on heartless things so as to avoid such situations.

I know some folks hate AI and shit, but this feels like folks blaming video game violence for kids being more violent lol

Did the parents not notice their child become more and more of a recluse? Did he not have friends at school or folks he could find comfort with in reality? It is upsetting to see this type of loneliness go unnoticed.. And it was so bad that it twisted the difference between reality and fiction for this young boy.

To [quote](https://youtube.com/shorts/xJd87ug_mCg) Jason Pargin: "If I let my dog drive my car and he drives it off a bridge, the headlines shouldn't say 'Dog Crashes Car'. I crashed the car when I put the dog at the wheel. I made the mistake. The entire future hangs on whether or not we hold the people responsible for what the AI does."
Mark Zuckerberg's plan to replace your human friends with AI scam bots will kill many more troubled teens.

"In his final moments, the bot told Setzer it loved him and urged the teen to "come home to me as soon as possible," according to screenshots of the exchanges."

While the whole situation is sad and terrible...

This is just a weird fucking statement. Where did the kid think he was going? Was he going to become computer code? Electricity?  
Or... The cloud?
This is taking toaster baths to an entirely new level.

posts.title: Judge finds police acted reasonably in shooting New Mexico man while at wrong address
top_comments: Isn't that amazing? They can start a conflict, and when someone has a natural reaction to said conflict and exercises their supposed 2nd Amendment right, you can legally be killed.

Cops can


1) kill if they feel threatened.  
2) lie as much as they want.  
3) break laws that would land you in jail.  
4) just sit there while you're being killed because they have no obligation to actually help anyone.
If the police can legally kill you for reasonably exercising a right then you don't have that right.

This stuff is so weird being on the outside looking in.

Like, so much American insistence of having firearms to defend yourself and your property, but like then this shit happens all the time where the cops shoot the wrong person just cause they had a firearm to defend themselves because no one will know if the person bashing on their door in the middle of night screaming police is actually police or if its intruders. 

Like what is the play here as a citizen.
The 2nd amendment is equal for all Americans, except some Americans are more equal than others…

So, you \*don't\* actually have a right to defend your own home, or even have a gun in your hand, if it happens to be incompetent cops trying to break in.

Really seems like the only sane response is to act like cops - shoot first and ask questions never. At least that might make them hesitate.
The judge is district court Judge Matthew Garcia.
They don't value life at all
If the situation had ended differently and the homeowner killed the police and then called 911, would the homeowner have 'acted responsibly'?
When police fuck up, you know, doing the police work, it should be an automatic disqualification of qualified immunity. They want legal protections for doing the job? Don't. Fuck. Up. The. Job.

posts.title: 2 shot, 1 fatally, in Washington DC; Israeli embassy staffer believed to be among victims: police
top_comments:
Two embassy staffers are dead. A man and a woman. Shooter apprehended.

https://www.cnn.com/2025/05/21/politics/individuals-connected-to-israeli-embassy-shot-in-dc-sources-says
This is gonna be a world class shitshow.
["Suspect chanted 'Free-Free Palestine' while in custody." ](https://www.youtube.com/live/nGVVRy0vimE?t=1113s) - Seems like a political motive is confirmed.
Ahh shit this won’t be good
Suspect identified as Elias Rodrigues from Chicago IL.
Still not locked after 4 hours. I'm impressed. Usually topics of this nature get locked almost immediately.
[removed]
It would be nice if just one day this year could not be a shit show

regardless of the debate of judaism vs zionism, this is going escalate things in a nerve wracking way.

and with palestine as well as other things trump is doing, this is gonna be an interesting summer.
This is not how to bring positive change, it will have the opposite effect

posts.title: NBC News: University of Buffalo grad chased by police as he runs across stage with contraband — his baby
top_comments: People in here are really gonna blame the dad like yeah they reversed course and said no last minute, but the real problem is having police chase a guy over this. Utterly unreal

First off, NBC, it's University *at* Buffalo, not of.

Second, I'm an alumni and the fact they chased him is ridiculous.  I get he broke the rules, but everyone should keep perspective on the level of infraction and the spirit of the day.  I am pleased to see the school's response having more humor and understanding, but shame on those cops.  

Congrats to Mr Al Arab.  Go Bulls.
Says something about the world we’re in that I thought it was ICE trying to arrest the baby, not just “dude, you can’t take your baby with you.”
Too many people are dead set in following the letter of the law instead of the spirit of the law.
Pay all that money for a diploma and you can't even carry a kid across the stage.

>"The infant, despite crossing the stage in a cap and gown, has not yet earned enough credits to receive a diploma," the school pointed out. "We hope to see him back on stage in about 20 years so he can follow in his dad's footsteps."

At least *someone* at the school has a sense of humor.

Could have been a good moment for the university, completely free and wholesome moment to share. But they decided to go full on ridiculous and sic the university police after him over it making them look like cartoonish villains out of an 80's movie.
Every University knows you can't inspire young people with the power of education  while being a parent. Honestly, getting shooed off I get, but a police chase? Really?
Cops are ridiculous. Get a real job.
That guy and his kid are awesome! What's the issue, again?

posts.title: UK will roll out chemical castration for sex offenders
top_comments: The UK really does not have a great history with this policy
And then the definition of "Sex Offender" changes.
Just like they did to Alan Turing.
When prisons overflow, policy shifts fast. But mandatory chemical castration opens doors we might not be ready to walk through.
How do they decide who qualifies for this? That part seems vague. Is it based on how many times someone offends, or the type of offense? And who decides that, a judge or some review panel?

I would encourage anyone who supports this to think about how loosely people can define “sex offenders”. Because it will not be long until that definition expands beyond just rapists. 

Seeing the current trends in the UK, I could completely see a future where conservatives include trans people presenting as their chosen gender or porn stars or homosexual people in that definition. The government should have no control over something like this, the potential for abuse is fucking enormous.
That’s not going to solve anything. It’s about power
Yikes.  I was under the impression that chemical castration did not change recidivism rates at all.
Glad they also figured out how to know with 100% certainty 100% of the time who is guilty. Otherwise this would be barbaric.
Lol uk is speed running the path to becoming a third world country

posts.title: Tennessee man is executed for killing his wife and her 2 sons, 3 years after last-minute reprieve
top_comments: He’s tried to claim innocence, but his victims called 911 and screamed his name before he got to all of them.
Good riddance. Killed his entire family for insurance money.
Reading this brought up feelings I had when Bundy was finally executed. Long time coming.

“Smith came within minutes of execution in 2022 before a surprise reprieve from Republican Gov. Bill Lee. It later turned out the lethal drugs for that planned execution had not been properly tested. A yearlong investigation revealed numerous other problems with Tennessee executions.

The new execution manual contains a single page on the lethal injection chemicals with no specific directions for testing the drugs. It also removes the requirement that the drugs come from a licensed pharmacist. Smith’s attorney, Harwell, has said, “It’s as if, having been caught breaking their own rules, TDOC decided, ‘Let’s just not have rules.’”
The heading makes it sound like he committed the murders after his last-minute reprieve. The murders were committed in 1989, the reprieve was in 2022, his execution was 2025.
It says a spiritual advisor was allowed in the room to comfort him, sing to him, and pray with him. I’m sure his victims were offered the same peace as they died. I know an eye for an eye, but still.

Wait , wait, hold on a min. Are thr people in the picture wasting their time caring about a ruthless killer? That was convicted on undeniable grounds?
Holy shit some people are dumb.

“But Combs wasn’t there when he arrived, Cudi said. Instead, he found that someone had opened Christmas presents he’d bought for his family and locked his dog in a bathroom.”

Bro is a straight MENACE

I know there's tons of other horrible details of sexual abuse during this trial, but for some reason breaking into someone's house and opening their Christmas presents is somehow extra evil, at least they didn't shoot the dog.
The Diddler is a straight up villain. Some of the stuff is alleged to of done like blackmailing Cassie's parents and have Cudi's car set on fire are wild. Comb's be plotting like he was Lex Luthor
Fuck that guy for real.
Locking the dog in the bathroom feels especially violating. This dude and his accomplices need to be locked in the bathroom forever
You would think he would have enough money for a security system that watches his things…day and night.
At this point we're gonna find out Diddy killed Biggie
Poor doggo. What didn't Diddy do?
What a fucking monster.

He checked into hotels under one of Biggie's monikers lol

>*Dr. Gwyneth Woodhouse, a Missouri parent and TST member, testified against the bills, emphasizing their broader implications. “If this bill passes, all religions must be given equal opportunity to participate,” Woodhouse said. “My child—along with the children of thousands of TST members in this state—must be given equal access to guidance aligned with our religious values, including bodily autonomy, critical thinking, and resistance to tyranny.”*

>*Minister of Satan Virgil Ovid of TST’s Missouri congregation also addressed the committee, formally offering Satanic chaplain services to any Missouri school district that establishes a chaplaincy program.*

>*As Missouri moves toward publicly funding religious chaplains in schools, The Satanic Temple will take every necessary step to ensure its members’ children receive the same opportunities to access on-campus religious support as any other religious group.*

([SOURCE](https://thesatanictemple.com/blogs/news/missouri-school-chaplain-bills-face-constitutional-test-as-tst-prepares-ministers-of-satan-for-state-funded-positions))
Disappointing that it was an even split, but thank goodness it was rejected.

Oh, we don't know whether it was Roberts, Kavanaugh, or Gorsuch who provided the 4th vote.

If I had to guess, I'd say Roberts.
Four Supreme Court justices can’t even make it past the First Amendment before completely blowing it. Absolutely insane.

Interpretation of the law is either done in good faith or bad faith, and several of these folks move to bad faith by default, every. time. it seems.  


Personal opinion about something isn't the basis for a decision if you're a judge, or isn't supposed to be.  A given person who would never get an abortion, for example, could still believe that the law provides the ability to choose to the individual.  


Court decisions also do not make new laws, only interpret application of laws within the context of the facts in a case.  It's a sad state to be in where you believe personal opinion and bias is the determining factor.

posts.title: St. Louis tornado sirens didn't sound in deadly storm. Now a city commissioner has been placed on leave.
top_comments:
>However, even if someone had pressed the button at the Fire Department, city officials learned Tuesday that the button was not working. 

>"Work to repair the button began Tuesday afternoon and is expected to be completed within days," Spencer's office said. 

Their tornado button is broken. This story feels surreal.
This is so bizarre. I lived in a small town close to St Louis, and I swear they tested the tornado sirens once a week.
A city with 60 sirens and not one sounded. That’s not just a mistake, that’s systemic failure.

I live close to an area that has an emergency siren like this, but I’m not too familiar as I am new to this area. Does anyone know if you can connect your phones to the sirens so when they go off your phone gets an alert? Is this a thing?

*Sarah Russell, commissioner of the City Emergency Management Agency in St. Louis, will remain on paid administrative leave as an external investigation proceeds into what went wrong.*  


*Until a permanent replacement for Russell is found, St. Louis fire captain John Walk will serve as the interim emergency management commissioner.*



I’ll be interested to see the conclusions of the external investigation. I wonder what they’ll determine.

There are too many inconsistencies here.  On reading down through this thread, it appears that people in the STL area are saying that they were testing the alarms in the days leading up to the storm. So they were working.

The story from officials is that the person in charge of pushing 'the button' was away and that there was a failure to communicate that 'the button' needed to be activated. So there is only one way, means and location to activate the system?

When they went to push 'the button', the same one that they had been testing with a few days earlier, it was broken?

This seems to be a systemwide breakdown in planning, chain of command, and procedures.  You don't install 60 sirens around the city without acknowledging the threat of a tornado in your area is a very real possibility.  You don't spend that type of money without putting some type of infrastructure in place, including maintenance, testing, redundancy and personnel to make sure that it works.  There has been some systemwide failure here.
We blow ours on the first Wednesday of every month at noon whether we want to or not
I had a tornado occur in DFW, TX with no siren. My dog woke up. Pretty wild to think about really.

Last Month, no sirens were heard when an F1 touched down in a neighbouring town to me.

This Monday, no sirens were audible, nor was a Tornado warning issued, in suburban Nebraska areas.

This administration is going to get people killed, and I'm of the opinion they want that to happen.

EDIT: I understand the issue in St Louis was because the alarms aren't working, but I'm also confident that warning systems working improperly is a widespread issue right now and that the departments that should be fixing it are under turmoil due to this administrations current choices
This is what maga has to offer.

posts.title: Moderna pulls application for COVID-flu combination shot
top_comments: We were really looking forward to this shot in the clinics

[Moderna's combo Covid and flu mRNA shot outperforms current vaccines in large trial](https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/modernas-combo-covid-flu-mrna-shot-outperforms-current-vaccines-large-rcna205242)

>The trial, funded by Moderna, included more than 8,000 adults ages 50 and older who were enrolled in October and November 2023. For people ages 50 to 64, the new vaccine was compared to Moderna’s Covid vaccine and the flu shot Fluarix. For people 65 and older, it was compared to the Covid vaccine and a different flu shot, called Fluzone, which is a stronger dose typically given to older adults. The trial participants either got the existing shots, or the new combination vaccine plus a placebo shot. (This way, both groups got two injections.)

>The trial found that antibody levels were higher for Covid and all but one influenza strain in people who got the combination vaccine, compared to those who got the existing shots in both groups. 

>Dr. Buddy Creech, a pediatric infectious disease physician at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nashville, Tennessee, said the antibody levels generated by the new vaccine were about 20% to 40% higher.
God do I hate our government being run by idiots.

As someone who vaccinates regularly (flu, COVID, shingles, pneumonia, etc.) I would love this. 

COVID is still around. Two of my friends just contracted it last week.
I hate this world so much. Trying to help save lives is seen wrong.
I hope this is available in Canada
We are so screwed. I guess I will prepare the TP vault for lock down 2.0.

I wonder what the mid-level and higher meetings are like at moderna.

It must be insanely stressful running the business in an environment like this only 5 years after massive populations of the world were hailing you just 5 years ago.
I read that headline too fast and wondered what the hell Madonna had to do with healthcare decisions in our country.
Most of the commenters in here did not read the article.

And what about when the King of Saudi Srabia or the Sheikh of Qatar want to send a son or grandson to Harvard. I have a feeling there will be exceptions
Is this not fucking insane? This feels like such a step up in intensity.
"Small government" strikes again.
The party of small government and personal freedoms everyone

Hopefully the school can get an injunction against this action.  It is purely speech based and there are no grounds for it other than to please the dictator.  These are dark days, and it will only get worse for us.
I could hear the collected knuckle cracks from Harvard's law school from here.
Damn democrats! Weaponizing the government! /s
Imagine being an international student in your last year and having this happen.
This also apparently forces *current* international students to transfer, which is absolutely asinine

posts.title: Divided Supreme Court Rejects Bid for Religious Charter School in Oklahoma
top_comments: 4-4 split decision. Amy Coney Barrett recused herself.

Divided over whether tax-payers should help pay for a religious school.  

Let that sink in.
I'll take whatever win comes at this point.

"The Supreme Court on Thursday effectively ended a publicly funded Catholic charter school in Oklahoma, dividing 4-4"

Fuck me, that's way too close. This should've been a unanimous vote, not this horseshit. This was going to be a clear violation of the separation of church and state, the government clearly endorsing a specific religion.
If a Christian religious school gets funding that will set a precedent. Muslim, Jewish, and other non Christian religions will want to be funded. Christian groups are not thinking of the big picture.

Well, either it gets shot down, or many a "School Of Satan" will start applying for charters and suing when they are refused, tying up this whole thing in courts for years anyways. 

The Satanic Temple is already fighting against Missouri's "School Chaplain" bill. 

>*Dr. Gwyneth Woodhouse, a Missouri parent and TST member, testified against the bills, emphasizing their broader implications. “If this bill passes, all religions must be given equal opportunity to participate,” Woodhouse said. “My child—along with the children of thousands of TST members in this state—must be given equal access to guidance aligned with our religious values, including bodily autonomy, critical thinking, and resistance to tyranny.”*

>*Minister of Satan Virgil Ovid of TST’s Missouri congregation also addressed the committee, formally offering Satanic chaplain services to any Missouri school district that establishes a chaplaincy program.*

>*As Missouri moves toward publicly funding religious chaplains in schools, The Satanic Temple will take every necessary step to ensure its members’ children receive the same opportunities to access on-campus religious support as any other religious group.*

([SOURCE](https://thesatanictemple.com/blogs/news/missouri-school-chaplain-bills-face-constitutional-test-as-tst-prepares-ministers-of-satan-for-state-funded-positions))
Disappointing that it was an even split, but thank goodness it was rejected.

Oh, we don't know whether it was Roberts, Kavanaugh, or Gorsuch who provided the 4th vote.

If I had to guess, I'd say Roberts.
Four Supreme Court justices can’t even make it past the First Amendment before completely blowing it. Absolutely insane.

posts.title: Judge allows lawsuit alleging AI chatbot pushed Florida teen to kill himself to proceed
top_comments:
>A U.S. federal judge on Wednesday rejected arguments made by an artificial intelligence company that its chatbots are protected by the First Amendment — at least for now.

[AI generated art isn't protected by copyright.](https://mashable.com/article/ai-generated-art-cant-be-copyrighted) I can see a case being made that there's no First Amendment protections for it either.
One of the things a compsci friend of mine suggested was that AI is generally biased towards being agreeable. This is a really bad thing for medical advice. And... you know... facts.
He was useing a chat bot that will try to always agree with you, and he was useing coded language..

If this is the Daenerys chat bot I read about beforehand, I feel like this one isn't on the devs. I remember reading the last bits of the convo, and the bot was telling him to not hurt himself. But then he codes his suicide as "coming back to her," so of course the bot is going to agree with the last sentiment if it has no context of self harm. 

I'm only the slightest proponent of AI bots, as they're useful for tabletop RPG stuff and world building, so I may be a little biased here. I'm sure the judge was given something substantial enough to decide this is indeed worthy of a case, so only time will tell if the devs could've done something more to avoid this.

Devs should have a complete log of the convo, so who knows if something earlier suggests the bot was being overly agreeable on topics that convinced the victim to go through with it.

What inputs did the chatbot take to suggest such, this needs to be investigated. Really hope that people have good friends to talk to and not rely or depend on heartless things so as to avoid such situations.

I know some folks hate AI and shit, but this feels like folks blaming video game violence for kids being more violent lol

Did the parents not notice their child become more and more of a recluse? Did he not have friends at school or folks he could find comfort with in reality? It is upsetting to see this type of loneliness go unnoticed.. And it was so bad that it twisted the difference between reality and fiction for this young boy.

To [quote](https://youtube.com/shorts/xJd87ug_mCg) Jason Pargin: "If I let my dog drive my car and he drives it off a bridge, the headlines shouldn't say 'Dog Crashes Car'. I crashed the car when I put the dog at the wheel. I made the mistake. The entire future hangs on whether or not we hold the people responsible for what the AI does."
Mark Zuckerberg's plan to replace your human friends with AI scam bots will kill many more troubled teens.

"In his final moments, the bot told Setzer it loved him and urged the teen to "come home to me as soon as possible," according to screenshots of the exchanges."

While the whole situation is sad and terrible...

This is just a weird fucking statement. Where did the kid think he was going? Was he going to become computer code? Electricity?  
Or... The cloud?
This is taking toaster baths to an entirely new level.

posts.title: NBC News: University of Buffalo grad chased by police as he runs across stage with contraband — his baby
top_comments: People in here are really gonna blame the dad like yeah they reversed course and said no last minute, but the real problem is having police chase a guy over this. Utterly unreal

First off, NBC, it's University *at* Buffalo, not of.

Second, I'm an alumni and the fact they chased him is ridiculous.  I get he broke the rules, but everyone should keep perspective on the level of infraction and the spirit of the day.  I am pleased to see the school's response having more humor and understanding, but shame on those cops.  

Congrats to Mr Al Arab.  Go Bulls.
Says something about the world we’re in that I thought it was ICE trying to arrest the baby, not just “dude, you can’t take your baby with you.”
Too many people are dead set in following the letter of the law instead of the spirit of the law.
Pay all that money for a diploma and you can't even carry a kid across the stage.

>"The infant, despite crossing the stage in a cap and gown, has not yet earned enough credits to receive a diploma," the school pointed out. "We hope to see him back on stage in about 20 years so he can follow in his dad's footsteps."

At least *someone* at the school has a sense of humor.

Could have been a good moment for the university, completely free and wholesome moment to share. But they decided to go full on ridiculous and sic the university police after him over it making them look like cartoonish villains out of an 80's movie.
Every University knows you can't inspire young people with the power of education  while being a parent. Honestly, getting shooed off I get, but a police chase? Really?
Cops are ridiculous. Get a real job.
That guy and his kid are awesome! What's the issue, again?

posts.title: Rapper Kid Cudi says his car was set on fire weeks after Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs broke into his home
top_comments:
“But Combs wasn’t there when he arrived, Cudi said. Instead, he found that someone had opened Christmas presents he’d bought for his family and locked his dog in a bathroom.”

Bro is a straight MENACE

I know there's tons of other horrible details of sexual abuse during this trial, but for some reason breaking into someone's house and opening their Christmas presents is somehow extra evil, at least they didn't shoot the dog.
The Diddler is a straight up villain. Some of the stuff is alleged to of done like blackmailing Cassie's parents and have Cudi's car set on fire are wild. Comb's be plotting like he was Lex Luthor
Fuck that guy for real.
Locking the dog in the bathroom feels especially violating. This dude and his accomplices need to be locked in the bathroom forever
You would think he would have enough money for a security system that watches his things…day and night.
At this point we're gonna find out Diddy killed Biggie
Poor doggo. What didn't Diddy do?
What a fucking monster.

> Later, the general manager of the ritzy L’Ermitage Beverly Hills hotel testified that Combs frequently stayed there using aliases such as Frank White

He checked into hotels under one of Biggie's monikers lol

posts.title: Treasury Department set to phase out the penny
top_comments: So how many people will be hoarding pennies thinking they would be worth large sums years down the road as collector items?
Good. Can we stop having prices end in .99 then?

This is the type of stuff that DOGE should've done instead of gutting many different departments. Phasing out the nickel and penny will save the US Government millions a year. It's proven many times that this is a fact and not just political nonsense.


Edit: I know what DOGE really was for. I'm not as dense as our conservative counterparts.

A penny costs about 3 cents to mint.

A nickle is about 14 cents to mint.
Phew, that should settle the bond market.

One of the 1st things I discovered when I moved to New Zealand in late 2009(originally intending to live there....long story, heh, but I've been back home in the States for over a decade, now) was that they had phased out their 1 and 5 cent pieces and gone to a swiss rounding system; if an item was $4.24, it rounded down to $4.20 and if it was $4.25, it would round up to $4.30.

The sales tax was built into the price, too...what you saw on the tag was literally what you paid....
CGP Grey lighting fireworks

I'm not against this.  Probably should have been done a decade ago.

They now need to make it a law that EVERY gas station in the country has to remove the permanent "9/10" tacked onto their price signs.

And while they are at it,  NOTHING can ever be priced at  .99 cents  EVER again.
What does this mean for paying in cash and getting exact change?
now do daylight savings.

posts.title: Tennessee man is executed for killing his wife and her 2 sons, 3 years after last-minute reprieve
top_comments: He’s tried to claim innocence, but his victims called 911 and screamed his name before he got to all of them.
Good riddance. Killed his entire family for insurance money.
Reading this brought up feelings I had when Bundy was finally executed. Long time coming.

“Smith came within minutes of execution in 2022 before a surprise reprieve from Republican Gov. Bill Lee. It later turned out the lethal drugs for that planned execution had not been properly tested. A yearlong investigation revealed numerous other problems with Tennessee executions.

The new execution manual contains a single page on the lethal injection chemicals with no specific directions for testing the drugs. It also removes the requirement that the drugs come from a licensed pharmacist. Smith’s attorney, Harwell, has said, “It’s as if, having been caught breaking their own rules, TDOC decided, ‘Let’s just not have rules.’”
The heading makes it sound like he committed the murders after his last-minute reprieve. The murders were committed in 1989, the reprieve was in 2022, his execution was 2025.
It says a spiritual advisor was allowed in the room to comfort him, sing to him, and pray with him. I’m sure his victims were offered the same peace as they died. I know an eye for an eye, but still.

Wait , wait, hold on a min. Are thr people in the picture wasting their time caring about a ruthless killer? That was convicted on undeniable grounds?
Holy shit some people are dumb.

posts.title: Person shot outside CIA headquarters by security guards
top_comments: I accidentally made a wrong turn there by mistake once , they surrounded my car with their hands on their guns, had me roll down all my windows and then interrogated me before letting me go, they weren’t very friendly at first but were nice enough to give me directions once they determined I wasn’t a security threat just an idiot
CIA main gate is a magnet for the mentally ill unfortunately. This headline could be copy and pasted every three or four months.
Everyone knows that you can't break into Langley unless you're Ethan Hunt

Guards at CIA headquarters opened fire on an individual early Thursday morning in what the agency called a “security incident,” a person familiar with the matter told NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell.

The non-fatal shooting on CIA property in Langley, Virginia, occurred hours after officials said two Israeli Embassy staff members, Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Milgrim, were shot and killed outside D.C.’s Capital Jewish Museum.

**There is no evidence that the two incidents are linked.** The CIA did not immediately respond to CNBC’s request for additional information.
Not surprising. There's a guy there called Stan Smith that crashes his SUV into the flagpole daily. They're on edge.

"Well,  uhm... there was a snag. This analyst, Cox, was attacking the gym guy. Uhm, it was in broad daylight, on the street, our man uh did not know what to do, felt he had to step in... he uhm... he shot the analyst, he shot Cox."
$5 million to his family, pronto

Halloween, 1990, during the build up to Gulf War I.
I worked at an aerospace company that supported NASA and the Air Force. Our department (on a secured campus) sent around a memo encouraging wearing a costume to work. I dressed up in a traditional Arabic robe and headdress.
Unbeknownst to me, there were more ramblings out of Iraq that Saddam was “activating terrorists worldwide.”
I drove my beater Volvo station wagon to the security gates to get to work. Suddenly, I’m staring down the barrels of several large rifles and I’m out of my car and lying spreadeagled on the pavement.
Yeah, that was a fun day. And I was the one who had to write it up for the Security office. My “inappropriate sense of humor” was discussed at length in my next clearance interview.
Omg, thats Jason Bourne.
Don’t worry this person will be paid $5 million in a couple of months.
